title: Crowdfunding Innovation and Entrepreneurship
body: Featured profile on crowdfunding platform innovation, entrepreneurial technology development, and the intersection of engineering, business, and regulatory policy in emerging financial markets.

title: Ways to Change the World
body: Featured in Wired Magazine's special edition guest-edited by Bill Clinton and Bill Gates, highlighting crowdfunding innovation and democratizing access to capital for entrepreneurs and changemakers globally.

title: Crowdfunding for Social Impact
body: Expert commentary on crowdfunding platforms enabling social entrepreneurs and community-driven projects, exploring how technology democratizes capital access for purpose-driven ventures.

title: A Year Late, S.E.C. Weighs In With 585 Pages of Crowdfunding Rules
body: Expert commentary on SEC's proposed crowdfunding regulations following the JOBS Act, analyzing the regulatory framework's impact on platforms and investors in the emerging crowdfunding industry.

title: RocketHub Ponders Its Future in Crowdfunding
body: Featured in NYT Boss blog piece profiling RocketHub's strategic positioning in the evolving crowdfunding landscape, examining platform innovation, regulatory challenges, and the future of democratized capital access.

title: 8-Episode Crash Course in Crowdfunding
body: Eight-episode educational series on crowdfunding fundamentals, platform strategies, regulatory compliance, and best practices for entrepreneurs seeking to raise capital through crowdfunding campaigns.

title: Crowdfunding Platform RocketHub Acquired
body: Extensively quoted about the acquisition deal's significance. Assured that RocketHub was "by no means going away... it's being fed steroids" under EFactor. Described plans to expand services for entrepreneurs by combining crowdfunding with mentorship.

title: CrowdFund Investing: Emphasis Turning to Implementation
body: Interviewed by Alan Hall about the post-JOBS Act crowdfunding era. As RocketHub's co-founder/CFO, discussed moving from legislative passage to implementation, emphasizing the need for entrepreneur-friendly rules.

title: Equity crowdfunding sites court investors, startups
body: Quoted expressing excitement about democratized investing: "What I am excited about is allowing anyone to do what accredited investors do." Crain's noted RocketHub's role and optimism that everyday people could soon invest in startups like angels.
